title.narrative: IR 2.2 QUALITE DE L'EDUCATION

description.narrative: IR 2.2: By the end of 2018, the learning results in reading and mathematics from first to 3rd grade and in life skills from first to sixth grade improves for at least 70% of pupils and the primary gross rate of completion increases from 56% in 2010 to at least 85 % in 2017

related-activity.ref: 0990/A0/06/002 ÉDUCATION PRIMAIRE DE QUALITE POUR TOUS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.2: By the end of 2018, the learning results in reading and mathematics from first to 3rd grade and in life skills from first to sixth grade improves for at least 70% of pupils and the primary gross rate of completion increases from 56% in 2010 to at least 85 % in 2017

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the capacity building of 916 (82 women) headmasters and school inspectors and 75,266 teachers on reading, math and life skills through a cost-effective close supervision and school network approach, that allowed a higher coverage of trainees to implement the curricular reform for the use of the four national languages (Lingala, Swahili, Tshiluba, Kikongo). 154,822 students (77,275 girls) received individual education/early learning materials. To avoid duplication and inequitable breakdown between provinces, UNICEF provided support to the Global Partnership for Education (GPE) funded project PAQUE to prepare the distribution of learning materials all over the country. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Number of children that received subsidies, scholarships, grants or social assistance from UNICEF to attend primary school
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
